Behzad Nabavi

Computer Engineering Student at Sharif University of Technology

CV

About Me

I am a Bachelor of Science graduate in Computer Engineering at Sharif University of Technology. My research interests lie in the intersection of computer science and economics, including algorithmic game theory, mechanism design, and computational social choice. As an undergraduate student, I have gained valuable research experiences. I had been working at TEIAS under the supervision of Prof. Masoud Seddighin, focusing on the metric distortion through the learning-augmented framework. Additionally, I had the opportunity to collaborate remotely with Prof. Grant Schoenebeck from the University of Michigan, where our research focused on peer review modeling using the Stackelberg game.

Working Papers

  • Conference Design With Strategic Authors  [link]

    Yichi Zhang, Behzad Nabavi, Grant Schoenebeck

Research Experience

Tehran Institute for Advanced Studies (TEIAS)

Research Assistant under the supervision of Prof. Masoud Seddighin,   Sep. 2023 - Present

Collaborated with Golnoosh Shahkarami from the Max-Planck Institute (MPI) to address the metric distortion problem through the learning-augmented framework and improved the consistency-robustness trade-off for the randomized voting rules.

University of Michigan

Research Intern under the supervision of Prof. Grant Schoenebeck,   Jun. 2023 - Nov. 2023

Worked on modeling the conference peer review process as a Stackelberg game, analyzing and comparing different conference designs using key metrics such as review burden, conference value, and average author utility.

Institute for Research in Fundamental Sciences (IPM)

Research Assistant under the supervision of Prof. Samira Hossein Ghorban,   Jun. 2023 - Sep. 2023

Assisted Prof. Samira Hossein Ghorban in developing lecture notes for the Game Theory course, conducted research and literature reviews to ensure the accuracy and comprehensiveness of the lecture notes.

Teaching Experience

  • Numerical Computation, Instructor: Prof. Samira Hossein Ghorban (Fall 2023, Fall 2024) - Teaching Assistant
  • Scientific and Technical Presentation, Instructor: Prof. Shohreh Kasaei (Spring 2024, Fall 2024) - Teaching Assistant
  • Algorithmic Game Theory, Instructor: Prof. Masoud Seddighin (Spring 2023, Spring 2024) - Head Teaching Assistant of Coding Assignment
    • Created video lectures for Linear Programming workshop.
    • Collaborated on course projects' design and implementation.
    • Held quizzes and graded the papers.
  • Machine Learning, Instructor: Prof. Fatemeh Seyyedsalehi (Spring 2024) - Teaching Assistant
  • Game Theory, Instructor: Marzie Nilipour (Spring 2023) - Teaching Assistant
  • Compiler Design, Instructor: Samaneh Hosseinmardi (Spring 2023) - Teaching Assistant
  • Probability and Statistics, Instructor: Prof. Ali Sharifi-Zarchi (Fall 2022) - Teaching Assistant
  • Fundamentals of Programming, Instructor: Alireza A. Mohammadi (Spring 2022) - Teaching Assistant
